Package model

Interface IPixel

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Pixel
    public interface IPixel
    Represents an RGB pixel.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      int getB()
      The following integer gets the value of the B component in the pixel.
      int getG()
      The following integer gets the value of the G component in the pixel.
      int getIntensity()
      The following integer will return the average of the RGB components, which is called intensity,
      int getLuma()
      The following integer will return the luma rounded down to an integer.
      int getR()
      The following integer gets the value of the R component in the pixel.
      int getValue()
      The following integer will return the highest of the RGB components, which is called value.

    • Method Detail

      • getR

        int getR()
        The following integer gets the value of the R component in the pixel.
        Returns:
        it will return the value of the r component

      • getG

        int getG()
        The following integer gets the value of the G component in the pixel.
        Returns:
        it will return the value of the g component

      • getB

        int getB()
        The following integer gets the value of the B component in the pixel.
        Returns:
        it will return the value of the B component

      • getIntensity

        int getIntensity()
        The following integer will return the average of the RGB components, which is called intensity,

        rounded down to an integer.
        Returns:
        the average of the three components for each pixel as an integer

      • getValue

        int getValue()
        The following integer will return the highest of the RGB components, which is called value.
        Returns:
        the maximum value of the three components for each pixel

      • getLuma

        int getLuma()
        The following integer will return the luma rounded down to an integer.
        Returns:
        the luma uses the formula (0.2126r + 0.7152g + 0.0722b), and results as an integer
